channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Indurex Emerges From Stealth to Close Security Gap in Cyber-Physical Systems
item.description: Indurex was founded by Jalal Bouhdada, who previously led industrial cybersecurity company Applied Risk. The post Indurex Emerges From Stealth to Close Security Gap in Cyber-Physical Systems appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fortinet Patches Exploited FortiCloud SSO Authentication Bypass
item.description: Tracked as CVE-2026-24858, the bug allows attackers to log into devices registered to other FortiCloud accounts. The post Fortinet Patches Exploited FortiCloud SSO Authentication Bypass appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: High-Severity Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Patched in OpenSSL
item.description: A total of 12 vulnerabilities have been fixed in OpenSSL, all discovered by a single cybersecurity firm. The post High-Severity Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Patched in OpenSSL appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: [AINews] Moonshot Kimi K2.5 - Beats Sonnet 4.5 at half the cost, SOTA Open Model, first Native Image+Video, 100 parallel Agent Swarm manager
item.description: China takes another huge leap ahead in open models

item.title: Agentic Business Process Management Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.18833v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Since the early 90s, the evolution of the Business Process Management (BPM) discipline has been punctuated by successive waves of automation technologies. Some of these technologies enable the automation of individual tasks, while others focus on...

item.title: LLM Driven Design of Continuous Optimization Problems with Controllable High-level Properties
item.description: arXiv:2601.18846v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Benchmarking in continuous black-box optimisation is hindered by the limited structural diversity of existing test suites such as BBOB. We explore whether large language models embedded in an evolutionary loop can be used to design optimisation...

item.title: Explainable Uncertainty Quantification for Wastewater Treatment Energy Prediction via Interval Type-2 Neuro-Fuzzy System
item.description: arXiv:2601.18897v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Wastewater treatment plants consume 1-3% of global electricity, making accurate energy forecasting critical for operational optimization and sustainability. While machine learning models provide point predictions, they lack explainable uncertainty...

item.title: RIFT: Reordered Instruction Following Testbed To Evaluate Instruction Following in Singular Multistep Prompt Structures
item.description: arXiv:2601.18924v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly relied upon for complex workflows, yet their ability to maintain flow of instructions remains underexplored. Existing benchmarks conflate task complexity with structural ordering, making it difficult to...

item.title: Neural Theorem Proving for Verification Conditions: A Real-World Benchmark
item.description: arXiv:2601.18944v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Theorem proving is fundamental to program verification, where the automated proof of Verification Conditions (VCs) remains a primary bottleneck. Real-world program verification frequently encounters hard VCs that existing Automated Theorem Provers...

item.title: NavFormer: IGRF Forecasting in Moving Coordinate Frames
item.description: arXiv:2601.18800v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Triad magnetometer components change with sensor attitude even when the IGRF total intensity target stays invariant. NavFormer forecasts this invariant target with rotation invariant scalar features and a Canonical SPD module that stabilizes the...

item.title: Latent Structural Similarity Networks for Unsupervised Discovery in Multivariate Time Series
item.description: arXiv:2601.18803v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper proposes a task-agnostic discovery layer for multivariate time series that constructs a relational hypothesis graph over entities without assuming linearity, stationarity, or a downstream objective. The method learns window-level sequence...

item.title: Variational Quantum Circuit-Based Reinforcement Learning for Dynamic Portfolio Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2601.18811v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper presents a Quantum Reinforcement Learning (QRL) solution to the dynamic portfolio optimization problem based on Variational Quantum Circuits. The implemented QRL approaches are quantum analogues of the classical neural-network-based Deep...

item.title: VAE with Hyperspherical Coordinates: Improving Anomaly Detection from Hypervolume-Compressed Latent Space
item.description: arXiv:2601.18823v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Variational autoencoders (VAE) encode data into lower-dimensional latent vectors before decoding those vectors back to data. Once trained, one can hope to detect out-of-distribution (abnormal) latent vectors, but several issues arise when the latent...

item.title: IPBC: An Interactive Projection-Based Framework for Human-in-the-Loop Semi-Supervised Clustering of High-Dimensional Data
item.description: arXiv:2601.18828v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: High-dimensional datasets are increasingly common across scientific and industrial domains, yet they remain difficult to cluster effectively due to the diminishing usefulness of distance metrics and the tendency of clusters to collapse or overlap when...

item.title: Language Family Matters: Evaluating LLM-Based ASR Across Linguistic Boundaries
item.description: arXiv:2601.18899v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM)-powered Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems achieve strong performance with limited resources by linking a frozen speech encoder to a pretrained LLM via a lightweight connector. Prior work trains a separate connector...

item.title: Self-Aware Knowledge Probing: Evaluating Language Models' Relational Knowledge through Confidence Calibration
item.description: arXiv:2601.18901v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge probing quantifies how much relational knowledge a language model (LM) has acquired during pre-training. Existing knowledge probes evaluate model capabilities through metrics like prediction accuracy and precision. Such evaluations fail to...

item.title: Flatter Tokens are More Valuable for Speculative Draft Model Training
item.description: arXiv:2601.18902v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Speculative Decoding (SD) is a key technique for accelerating Large Language Model (LLM) inference, but it typically requires training a draft model on a large dataset. We approach this problem from a data-centric perspective, finding that not all...

item.title: BabyReasoningBench: Generating Developmentally-Inspired Reasoning Tasks for Evaluating Baby Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.18933v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Traditional evaluations of reasoning capabilities of language models are dominated by adult-centric benchmarks that presuppose broad world knowledge, complex instruction following, and mature pragmatic competence. These assumptions are mismatched to...

item.title: LLMs versus the Halting Problem: Revisiting Program Termination Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2601.18987v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Determining whether a program terminates is a central problem in computer science. Turing's foundational result established the Halting Problem as undecidable, showing that no algorithm can universally determine termination for all programs and...

item.title: Fortinet Patches CVE-2026-24858 After Active FortiOS SSO Exploitation Detected
item.description: Fortinet has begun releasing security updates to address a critical flaw impacting FortiOS that has come under active exploitation in the wild. The vulnerability, assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2026-24858 (CVSS score: 9.4), has been described as an authentication bypass related to FortiOS single...

item.title: NIO Launches Industry’s First “Cognitive” Intelligent Driving Solution
item.description: NIO Banyan 3.3.0 fully rolled out, first to apply the “World Model (NWM) + Closed-Loop Reinforcement Learning” paradigm.

item.title: XPeng Chairman Soars into Annual Meeting on Flying Car, Mass Delivery Expected in 2026
item.description: XPeng chairman He Xiaopeng made a dramatic entrance at the annual meeting aboard the modular X3 flying car, with mass deliveries expected in 2026.

item.title: China Launches Its First School of Space Exploration
item.description: China has inaugurated its first School of Space Exploration, aiming to cultivate talent and drive breakthroughs in deep-space research over the next two decades.

item.title: From Spring Festival Gala Appearances to USD 200+ Million Giveaways, China’s Internet Giants Reignite Lunar New Year Marketing Battle
item.description: China’s tech giants are reigniting Chinese New Year marketing with over USD 200 million in giveaways, as AI and robotics move to center stage at the Spring Festival Gala.

item.title: Geek+ Secures Over RMB 600 Million in Latin America Orders in 2025, Wins Backing from Daiwa and Morgan Stanley
item.description: Geek+ secured over USD 83 million in Latin American orders in 2025, reinforcing investor confidence as global banks back its expansion and a potential Stock Connect inclusion looms.

item.title: The first human test of a rejuvenation method will begin “shortly”
item.description: When Elon Musk was at Davos last week, an interviewer asked him if he thought aging could be reversed. Musk said he hasn’t put much time into the problem but suspects it is “very solvable” and that when scientists discover why we age, it’s going to be something “obvious.” Not long after, the...

item.title: OpenAI’s latest product lets you vibe code science
item.description: OpenAI just revealed what its new in-house team, OpenAI for Science, has been up to. The firm has released a free LLM-powered tool for scientists called Prism, which embeds ChatGPT in a text editor for writing scientific papers. The idea is to put ChatGPT front and center inside software that...

item.title: WhatsApp Rolls Out Lockdown-Style Security Mode to Protect Targeted Users From Spyware
item.description: Meta on Tuesday announced it's adding Strict Account Settings on WhatsApp to secure certain users against advanced cyber attacks because of who they are and what they do. The feature, similar to Lockdown Mode in Apple iOS and Advanced Protection in Android, aims to protect individuals, such as...

item.title: Experts Detect Pakistan-Linked Cyber Campaigns Aimed at Indian Government Entities
item.description: Indian government entities have been targeted in two campaigns undertaken by a threat actor that operates in Pakistan using previously undocumented tradecraft. The campaigns have been codenamed Gopher Strike and Sheet Attack by Zscaler ThreatLabz, which identified them in September 2025. "While...

item.title: Memcyco Raises $37 Million for Anti-Impersonation Technology
item.description: The startup will use the investment to fuel global expansion of its agentless platform, including in Latin America. The post Memcyco Raises $37 Million for Anti-Impersonation Technology appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Architectural Choices in China's Open-Source AI Ecosystem: Building Beyond DeepSeek
Over 100 Organizations Targeted in ShinyHunters Phishing Campaign
item.description: Domains set up by the threat actor suggest attacks aimed at Atlassian, Canva, Epic Games, HubSpot, Moderna, ZoomInfo, and WeWork. The post Over 100 Organizations Targeted in ShinyHunters Phishing Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Stratospheric internet could finally start taking off this year
item.description: Today, an estimated 2.2 billion people still have either limited or no access to the internet, largely because they live in remote places. But that number could drop this year, thanks to tests of stratospheric airships, uncrewed aircraft, and other high-altitude platforms for internet...

item.title: ClickFix Attacks Expand Using Fake CAPTCHAs, Microsoft Scripts, and Trusted Web Services
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new campaign that combines ClickFix-style fake CAPTCHAs with a signed Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) script to distribute an information stealer called Amatera. "Instead of launching PowerShell directly, the attacker uses this...

item.title: The Download: OpenAI’s plans for science, and chatbot age verification
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Inside OpenAI’s big play for science  —Will Douglas Heaven In the three years since ChatGPT’s explosive debut, OpenAI’s technology has upended a...

item.title: CTEM in Practice: Prioritization, Validation, and Outcomes That Matter
item.description: Cybersecurity teams increasingly want to move beyond looking at threats and vulnerabilities in isolation. It’s not only about what could go wrong (vulnerabilities) or who might attack (threats), but where they intersect in your actual environment to create real, exploitable exposure. Which...

Yet discovering GPCR modulators remains challenging because receptor activation often arises from complex allosteric effects rather than direct binding affinity, and conventional...

item.title: Inside OpenAI’s big play for science
item.description: In the three years since ChatGPT’s explosive debut, OpenAI’s technology has upended a remarkable range of everyday activities at home, at work, in schools—anywhere people have a browser open or a phone out, which is everywhere. Now OpenAI is making an explicit play for scientists. In October, the...
